content: Looks like a corrupt prefs.js file which has been renamed in prefs-x.js and replaced by a virgin prefs.js file (about 6 to 7kB size). In TB go to menu Help > Troubleshooting Information > Profile Folder > Open Folder... then quit TB. In the profile folder look for any prefs.js or prefs-x.js files and report them with their names and their sizes

content:
Essentially the Verizon system for mail is one large mess. Largely i think because AOL are not really managing anything it is Yahoo now and as they are owned by bankers it is not really a technology company.

However it sounds like you settings are not correct. SMTP should be using oauth as the authentication method and that is initially configured using web pages and an authentication token is stored in the password manager. But at no time does the little windows asking you for a password appear with the option to save the password, Re-authentication of Oauth uses a full page web page, usually badged as AOL IIRC

content:
Are you trying to unsubscribe "special folders "archive and the ones above it would not stay unsubscribed as they form part of your account definition.

Archive is listed in account settings as the archive location to archiving mail will see it reappear. Likewise all of the special folders with the special icons on them are not optional.

content:
You are more than welcome to rewrite the article and bring it up to date. I don't have the time or the inclination any longer.

I have no idea what you are talking about with contact and labels. Do Google contact have labels? Apparently they are used for creating mailing lists. I can use Google search. They certainly do not appear in Thunderbird as a mailing list as I just added a label to someone in my gmail contact and no mailing list with a single entry appearing in that address book locally after I syncronised the address book. But that does not suprise me as the contact sync is implemented with carddav which is based on the vcard standard. Vcards do not have mailing lists as a part of their description I do not think.

It appears the tbsync add-on does do something with groups using the Google people API . See https://github.com/zanonmark/Google-4-TbSync#current-status-and-roadmap--known-limitations

The calendar addon provider for google calendar offers tasks. Those are not included in the caldav standard and therefore are not included in the native calendar synchronization.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: Thanks for the prompt response! Now it's my turn to plead ignorance! I'm not familiar with Groups, but if they are like maillists, that's not what I am looking for. What I need is to be able to categorize my contacts, e.g. by church, family, personal, professional etc. Outlook calls these Categories. Google calls them Labels. Some other platforms call them tags. I don't care what they're called, as long as they can be ported across platforms. Outlook tries to store its categories in Google's data structure, but often fails. Although both Outlook and Thunderbird do pretty well syncing Google Labels and Mail Folders, Outlook makes no attempt to sync its Categories with Google's Labels. Is there anything I could use in Thunderbird to map to Google's Labels? An add-on would seem superfluous: TB is syncing both Calendar and Contacts with Google without any, and notes in the various Contacts add-ons I found suggest that they either don't work or aren't needed.
creator: rsbrux

content: I suppose you're talking about the Primary Password. The Primary Password protects the account password(s) of the email accounts you set up in Thunderbird. It does not protect the contents of the Thunderbird profile. Also see https://support.mozilla.org/kb/protect-your-thunderbird-passwords-primary-password
creator: christ1

content:
F10 makes the menu bar visible until you use it. That is it's purpose. I think holding the alt key does that same thing, except it disappears as soon as you stop holding the key.

When you have your menu, click on the View menu > Toolbar and then select the menu bar.

Try restarting Thunderbird from the help menu in troubleshooting mode and see if you can open a mail in that mode. Report your results.
creator: MattAuSupport

content: So you are trying to add a new account to Thunderbird. At least that is what it sounds like.

content: Go to Settings > General >Account Hub and uncheck "Create accounts in the new Account Hub"
creator: Mapenzi

content: If this is a POP account, the messages will remain. If an IMAP account, I encourage you to COPY (not move) all messages to Local Folders before closing the account.
creator: davidsk

content: Thanks David how do I copy all messages to a local folder?
creator: fourrr

content: First, make sure you have all the messages. clicking File>offline>download should do that Then, a clean way is this: - click help>troubleshootinginformation - scroll to 'profile folder' and click 'open folder' - EXIT thunderbird now - you are now in windows file explorer - your account is at imapmail\<IMAPaccount> messages are there, such as input, input.msf, sent, sent.msf - the Local Folders folder is at Mail\Local Folders - Click to the Imapmail\<imapaccount? folder in that folder and COPY the folders other than the msf entries and paste into the Mail\Local Folders folder. - restart thunderbird and the messages should be there </p>
creator: davidsk

content:
Hello

Apparently, the information (among other) is in the file, xulstore.json, in the profile folder.

You can try.

1 - Go to your profil folder https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/profiles-where-thunderbird-stores-user-data#w_how-do-i-find-my-profile 2 - Stop Thunderbird 3 - Delete the file xulstore.json (or rename it, for example, to xulstore.json-old) 4 - Start Thunderbird 5 - Perform your tests

A new xulstore.json file will be created. And, please check, xulstore.json -> right-click on it and select Properties -> Attributes -> the read-only box uncheck.
creator: Agentvirtuel

content:
Recent update now uses the 'Account Hub' by default. There are still some issues with this, so please disable it and then attempt to add new account. See image as guide.

Let us know if this works or not. If it works then please set this comment as a 'Chosen Solution' so others can easily locate help.

As a heads up.. I've had some info that it would be disabled automatically in version 140.4.0esr for adding a second account.
